name: riley-skills
description: Riley's personal development toolkit. Workflow automation, multi-model review orchestration, and project conventions.

skills.name: workflow
skills.description: Structured development workflow: architecture plan implementation with multi-model review loops, artifact management, exhaustive reviews, and Slack notifications. Use when starting implementation of an architecture plan, kicking off a review cycle, or resuming a workflow session.

skills.name: review
skills.description: Run a code review using an external model (Codex or Gemini). Gathers codebase context with dirgrab, invokes the model in read-only sandbox mode, presents structured results. Use when the user asks for a code review, codex review, or gemini review.

skills.name: external-models
skills.description: Reference for invoking external AI models (Codex, Gemini) from Claude Code. Capabilities, flags, strengths, weaknesses, and invocation patterns. Use when shelling out to another model for any purpose â€” reviews, multimodal analysis, agent tasks, or cross-model collaboration.

skills.name: dirgrab
skills.description: Gather codebase context with dirgrab CLI. Walks a directory, concatenates file contents into a single output for LLM consumption. Supports dry-run file listing (-l), comma-separated exclusions (-e), token stats (-s), and persistent config. Use when you need a code snapshot for analysis, review, or sharing with external tools like Gemini or Codex.

skills.name: init-project
skills.description: Initialize a project for Claude Code by scanning the personal MCP and snippet catalog, recommending items based on the tech stack, and writing the project's .mcp.json and CLAUDE.md. Use when setting up a new project, reconfiguring an existing one, or when the user says 'init project'.
